docs.snippet: The statute of limitations for financial crimes was increased to six years from five under the Dodd-Frank Act, Preet Bharara, the United States attorney for the Southern District of New York, noted at a conference Wednesday....
docs.abstract: The statute of limitations for financial crimes was increased to six years from five under the Dodd-Frank Act, Preet Bharara, the United States attorney for the Southern District of New York, noted at a conference Wednesday.

headline.main: The Statute of Limitations Is Longer Now, Bharara Warns Wrongdoers
